name: Ananya Health
headline: Portable cryoablation to prevent cervical cancer
description:
Building a standard-of-care medical device to freeze abnormal cells before they become cervical cancer, in any clinic, anywhere in the world, at 1/10 the cost.
--
Ananya Health is building a portable cryoablation unit designed for every primary care clinic in the world. Our beachhead application is cervical cancer prevention -- even though cervical cancer is easy to screen for, 80% of clinics worldwide lack the infrastructure and specialized staff to treat at the earliest stages. Our platform technology allows nurses and lower level health workers to treat at the point of care for 1/10 the cost of traditional ablation, and is the only cryo device that will help us achieve the WHO target to eliminate cervical cancer in our lifetime.

founders.name: Anu Parvatiyar, Founder
founders.description: Cofounder & CEO at Ananya Health. I‚Äôm a medical device engineer turned public health technologist. I love building products that expand access to healthcare in emerging markets ‚Äî from better data tools to improve childhood vaccination rates in Nigeria, to medical devices that allow nurses and midwives to deliver the same high-quality standard of medicine as specialized Ob/Gyns.

## Preventing cervical cancer in
## EVERY CLINIC, EVERYWHERE
Anchor 1
## Every 2 minutes, a woman dies of cervical cancer
### Although cervical cancer is more than 90% preventable, and treatable before it becomes malignant, 40+ million people with a cervix lack access to early prevention technologies ​each year.
### 1-3

###  A clinician can detect pre-cancerous cells through HPV DNA tests, Pap smears, VIA, and other routine methods at a local clinic.
### 6-10% of cervical screens are abnormal, meaning some sort of follow-up treatment or care is required.
### 4

## GAPS IN CARE
### 50% of patients who screen positive never follow up, due to
### at least one barrier.
### 5
![nitrogen canisters \(1\).png](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/6e8e40_1075c23457784cfc905eefe2d239e37c~mv2.png/v1/fill/w_53,h_74,al_c,q_85,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,blur_2,enc_avif,quality_auto/nitrogen%20canisters%20\(1\).png)

### Current standard of care treatment methods rely on a broken supply chain of costly, bulky gas canisters that are difficult to transport, or they require specialists like OB/GYNs who are limited in number.
## BARRIERS TO TREATMENT
### 6-7
![](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/f4f501_bb79fcebf8e74016ad42f4a265c9594b~mv2.png/v1/crop/x_614,y_115,w_653,h_895/fill/w_164,h_225,al_c,q_85,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,blur_3,enc_avif,quality_auto/f4f501_bb79fcebf8e74016ad42f4a265c9594b~mv2.png)
## ONSET OF CANCER
###  When pre-cancer cells are left untreated, they progress into cervical cancer ‚Äî meaning that instead of a simple intervention at a local clinic, a patient now faces surgery, chemotherapy, or radiation.

Anchor 2
## MEET CRCL
### TM
###### A portable, easy-to-use, and highly effective cryoablation platform that can be used in any clinic, anywhere, to prevent abnormal cervical lesions from progressing into cancer
![Untitled_Artwork \(7\).png](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/f4f501_6f96d62572304521b0ae3d61b59d0b02~mv2.png/v1/crop/x_0,y_322,w_1668,h_1744/fill/w_125,h_131,al_c,q_85,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,blur_2,enc_avif,quality_auto/Untitled_Artwork%20\(7\).png)
###### Closed loop system removes reliance on broken supply chain
###### Battery-powered with wheels for portability 
###### Probe tip delivers 5mm depth of freeze
### Our challenge is to ensure that...every woman over 30 is screened and treated for pre-cancerous lesions. To achieve that, we need innovative technologies and strategies.
### Dr. Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus WHO Director-General

## Preventing cervical cancer in

## Every 2 minutes, a woman dies of cervical cancer
### Although cervical cancer is more than 90% preventable, and treatable before it becomes malignant, 40+ million people with a cervix lack access to early prevention technologies ​each year.

###  A clinician can detect pre-cancerous cells through HPV DNA tests, Pap smears, VIA, and other routine methods at a local clinic.
### 6-10% of cervical screens are abnormal, meaning some sort of follow-up treatment or care is required.

## GAPS IN CARE
### 50% of patients who screen positive never follow up, due to
### at least one barrier.
### 5
![nitrogen canisters \(1\).png‚ü®9‚ü©].png)
![ananya health \(22\).png‚ü®10‚ü©].png)
### Current standard of care treatment methods rely on a broken supply chain of costly, bulky gas canisters that are difficult to transport, or they require specialists like OB/GYNs who are limited in number.
## BARRIERS TO TREATMENT
### 6-7
![](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/f4f501_bb79fcebf8e74016ad42f4a265c9594b~mv2.png/v1/crop/x_614,y_115,w_653,h_895/fill/w_164,h_225,al_c,q_85,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,blur_3,enc_avif,quality_auto/f4f501_bb79fcebf8e74016ad42f4a265c9594b~mv2.png)
## ONSET OF CANCER
###  When pre-cancer cells are left untreated, they progress into cervical cancer ‚Äî meaning that instead of a simple intervention at a local clinic, a patient now faces surgery, chemotherapy, or radiation.

## MEET CRCL
### TM
###### A portable, easy-to-use, and highly effective cryoablation platform that can be used in any clinic, anywhere, to prevent abnormal cervical lesions from progressing into cancer
![Untitled_Artwork \(7\).png‚ü®12‚ü©].png)
###### Closed loop system removes reliance on broken supply chain
###### Battery-powered with wheels for portability 
###### Probe tip delivers 5mm depth of freeze

generated_description:
Ananya Health is on a mission to tackle one of the most preventable yet devastating forms of cancer: cervical cancer. Founded in 2020 and thriving in the San Francisco area, this innovative health tech startup is revolutionizing how we approach early treatment of pre-cancerous cervical lesions with its portable cryoablation unit, making it accessible to clinics worldwide.

Here's the kicker: while cervical cancer is more than 90% preventable, a staggering 40 million people with a cervix miss out on crucial prevention technologies each year. They set out to change that by creating a system that costs just 1/10 of what traditional cryoablation systems do, which often rely on bulky gas canisters and specialized staff. Ananya's device allows nurses and other lower-level health care workers to provide treatment right where it's needed‚Äîat the point of care‚Äîsignificantly reducing barriers to access.

As a Y Combinator Batch S21 company, Ananya Health has been making waves, evidenced by their recent achievement of securing a $2.3 million grant from the National Cancer Institute. This funding will help expedite the development and optimization of their flagship product, the CRCL‚Ñ¢ system, designed to freeze abnormal cells effectively and painlessly.

The company‚Äôs team of six is led by co-founder and CEO Anu Parvatiyar, who, along with co-founder Julie Yip and CTO Allen Chang, brings diverse backgrounds in engineering, innovation, and health care to the table. They understand that the future of women‚Äôs health relies on overcoming existing treatment access barriers through innovative technology.

In the bigger picture, Ananya Health is aligned with global health efforts, seeking to contribute to the World Health Organization's goal of eliminating cervical cancer in our lifetime. Their vision is clear: to prevent cervical cancer in every clinic, everywhere, ensuring that no woman misses out on life-saving treatment.

In summary, if you want to know a company that‚Äôs harnessing cutting-edge technology to save lives, look no further than Ananya Health. They‚Äôre not just changing the narrative around cervical cancer; they‚Äôre rewriting it. For more details, check them out at [Ananya Health](https://www.ananya.health).
